title: Refined Characterizations of Approval-based Committee Scoring Rules
abstract: arXiv:2312.08799v2 Announce Type: replace-cross  Abstract: In approval-based committee (ABC) elections, the goal is to select a fixed-size subset of the candidates, a so-called committee, based on the voters' approval ballots over the candidates. One of the most popular classes of ABC voting rules are ABC scoring rules, which have recently been characterized by Lackner and Skowron (2021). However, this characterization relies on a model where the output is a ranking of committees instead of a set of winning committees and no full characterization of ABC scoring rules exists in the latter standard setting. We address this issue by characterizing two important subclasses of ABC scoring rules in the standard ABC election model, thereby both extending the result of Lackner and Skowron (2021) to the standard setting and refining it to subclasses. translated_title: 优化的基于批准的委员会评分规则的特征
translated_abstract: 在基于批准的委员会选举中，目标是根据选民对候选人的批准选票选择一个固定大小的候选人子集，即所谓的委员会。其中最流行的ABC投票规则之一是ABC评分规则，最近由Lackner和Skowron（2021年）进行了特征化。然而，该特征化依赖于一个模型，其中输出是对委员会的排名，而不是一组获胜委员会，并且在后一种标准设置中不存在ABC评分规则的完全特征化。我们解决了这个问题，通过对标准ABC选举模型中的两个重要ABC评分规则子类进行特征化，从而既将Lackner和Skowron（2021年）的结果扩展到标准设置，又将其细化到子类。具体而言，通过依赖于可变选区的一致性公理，我们特征化了（i）显著类别的Thiele规则和（ii）一个新
tldr: 该论文在标准ABC选举模型中对两个重要的ABC评分规则子类进行特征化，扩展了以往的研究结果并细化到子类。
